Background and Analysis:
	 
Governmental Accounting Standards Board (GASB) Statement number 45 requires the District to treat Other Post Employment Benefits (OPEB) on an accrual basis, rather than on a pay-as-you-go basis.  As a result, the District has contracted with the CalPERS California Employers’ Retiree Benefit Trust (CERBT), an irrevocable trust, to fund the district’s actuarial accrued liability.
	 
The District’s actuarial accrued liability as of June 30, 2012 was $117,564,565.  As of June 30, 2012, the District had transferred $5,311,801 to the irrevocable trust.  
	 
The Adopted Budget for 2012-13 included a contribution of $500,000 to fully fund the Annual Required Contribution (ARC) for this fiscal year.   Staff transferred $500,000 to the CERBT on March 29, 2013, as per the 2012-13 Adopted Budget.  The fair market value of the funds held with the CERBT as of March 31, 2013 was $7,963,785.
	 
	 
	 
	 
Submitted by:
					Kevin McElroy, Vice Chancellor of Business Services, x6201
Additional contact names:
					Hector Quinonez, x6250
Is backup provided?
					Yes

Background and Analysis:
	 
In preparation for the 2012-13 year-end audit, attached is a copy of the audit calendar, which lists key dates and events associated with the year-end audit process.
	 
The District, in coordination with our external auditors, Vavrinek, Trine, Day, & Company, LLP (VTD), Certified Public Accountants, has scheduled VTD to be on-site on five separate dates in order for VTD to complete their audit fieldwork. Contracting with locally based auditors, who can be on-site frequently, allows for better scheduling with the District and College staff as we work with the auditors in addressing required compliance and financial reporting audit matters.

Background and Analysis:
	 
The District currently contracts with an independent certified public accounting firm, Vavrinek, Trine, Day & Co., LLP (VTD), to perform operational reviews, also known as performance audits, in areas previously identified jointly by management and the Audit & Finance Committee.
	 
Over the last few years, the District contracted with VTD to perform audits on Measure E overhead, De Anza College cash handling procedures, District procurement card, Foothill College cash handling procedures, Measure C overhead, Police parking fees cash handling procedures, De Anza College facilities rental cash handling procedures, Foothill College Cashiering Services petty cash/change fund, and ERP security.  Most recently, the District contracted to perform audits on the Foothill College facilities rental program and the Foothill College Kinesiology & athletics gate receipts and concession operations.  These last two performance audits were presented to the Audit & Finance Committee at their regularly scheduled meeting of March 7, 2013.
	 
Annually, as a part of our risk assessment, District staff identify areas that require further audit review.  For fiscal year 2013-14, the District recommends contracting out for performance audits in the following areas:
	 
District Procurement Card 
Foothill College Associated Student Body Trust Accounts
Foothill College Cashiering Services (time permitting)
	 
	 
Submitted by:
					Kevin McElroy, Vice Chancellor of Business Services, x6201
Additional contact names:
					Hector Quinonez, x6250
Is backup provided?
					No
